results.text: You may have studied religion in depth, but this time you’re out of your depth. You have disadvantage on your next Religion check.
Though you may be graced with a prophetic vision, you are doomed to be disbelieved. No one believes any prophecy you deliver for the next [[/r 2d4]] weeks.
You try to reach out and determine if there are agents of good or evil nearby, but their presence alludes you. For the next minute creatures with the Good or Evil alignment are hidden from you.

Your shameless prying or hubris is not appreciated by the creature or deity in question. For the next minute you are struck either blind or deaf (as in the spell @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.6q34ttse78toj5x0]{Blindness/Deafness}) as determined by the Narrator.

You thought you remembered how this rite was supposed to be conducted, but it turns out you’re performing it wrong. You waste [[/r 1d4]] hours on attempts made to perform the rite correctly but to no avail.
You have committed some form of sacrilege in the presence of the divine and you have angered the deity in question. You gain one level of Strife.
